title: Interorganizational Learning Models: Science Project Collaboration Through Case Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific experimental methods and teamwork experience
context.additional_context: Learners apply an inter-organizational learning model to perform collaborative projects and solve local community issues in a limited-technology environment (primarily smartphones).

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more key success factors of interorganizational collaboration (e.g., leadership, stakeholder engagement).
Learners can propose organizational capacity-building strategies through case study analysis and apply them to local science projects.
Learners can document and evaluate the process of forming collective awareness through project-based assessments.

resources: Mobile-Compatible Learning Platform (Case Study Materials Included)
Community Science Project Kit for Local Environmental Issues (e.g., Water Quality Testing Tools)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
